dpul.title: "Digital PUL" link should clear language selection

comments.body: I'm thinking that changing the entire website language isn't feasible since we don't have enough translations in place. Instead, since we want to keep the language change limited to the scope of the current exhibit, and Anna and I were brainstorming for UI designs for the language dropdown to clarify that. This has been my favorite so far (or it would be after a little styling) but we're still working on it. ![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/62e3ec553e723055ba58287d/36319437-abf7-42b5-8ac8-b5ee7f8790c8)

figgy.title: Arabic section titles are not appearing as Right To Left in Universal Viewer

comments.body:
Implementation proposal:

In the Manifest Builder, check to see if a section label is RTL (`#dir`), if it is, then make it a RDF Literal with the language tag that's in the imported metadata's `#language` property.

Describe Form: Add "Collection" to the deposited work for PPPL Group

comments.body:
I'm taking a stab at the PPPL collections here based on the collections that are in DataSpace:

All under the Princeton Plasma Physics Lab group:
* Advanced Projects - Other Projects
* Advanced Projects - Stellarators
* Advanced Projects - System Studies
* Computational Science - PPPL Collaborations
* Engineering - Engineering Research
* ES&H - Technical Reports
* IT - PPPL Collaborations
* ITER and Tokamaks - PPPL Collaborations
* Spherical Torus - MAST-U
* Spherical Torus - NSTX
* Spherical Torus - NSTX-U
* Theory
* Plasma Science & Technology
* Theory and Computation

@astrochun Can you have a look at this list when you get a chance and let us know here what if anything is missing or needs to be corrected?

> @astrochun Can you have a look at this list when you get a chance and let us know here what if anything is missing or needs to be corrected?

Thanks for asking @kelynch. Several things that re-jog my memory:

1. Due to some recent reorganization "Plasma Science & Technology" became two departments:
- Discovery Plasma Science
- Applied Materials and Sustainability Sciences

We don't have any datasets for the latter and I had contemplated how best to change this in DataSpace or if we should just leave it alone. For example, we could simply rename PS&T collection so it can get easily migrated over. Does that make sense?

2. The Computational Science Department split from the Theory department about a year or so ago. I've wanted for sometime to work with CSD and Theory to go through the Theory and Computational collection and identify which ones belong to each group. That just hasn't happened due to other demands. If we want to do this, should this happen in DataSpace before the migration?

3. I never understood the origin/purpose of the "PPPL Collaborations" for IT, Computational Science, and ITER & Tokamaks. It has added to confusion and I wonder if it is better to just have them without that sub-collection. Does that prevent us from developing layers at a later point?

4. Finally, ITER & Tokamak should be "Tokamak Experience Sciences" due to some lab reorganization. Perhaps we should change this in DataSpace first? I don't think this impacts the ARK collection, correct?

5. I noticed that some departments are spelled out while others aren't. Perhaps it makes more sense to be explicit and provide the full name. Should we do this on the DataSpace side first?
